boat.name: Kate
boat.full_description:
Built at Hay & Co., Lerwick in 1910, 'Kate' was 41'6" long, Zulu class, clinker built with two lug sails.

In 1920, an engine was installed but by 1946 she was semi-derelict and bought by the Tait family of Burra. Re-named 'Sunbeam', fishing no. LK453, she continued to fish having had a complete overhaul and new engine.

In the 1960s she was sold to an owner in Lowestoft and laid up at Oulton Broad. Since 1998 Gramah Brewster and Don Windley have been restoring her, passing her into the hands of Martin Goodman in early 2012. Her name has been changed back to 'Kate'.
boat.short_description: Built by Hays & Co. in Lerwick, Shetland, 'Kate' is probably the only clinker Zulu left in the world.
